sections.title: INTRODUCTION
text: We designed our LED panels to be as simple as possible to install.
To do so, we made them compatible with a widely used standard called VESA.
VESA is initially made to hang screens against walls, the holders are cheap and available virtually anywhere.

sections.title: 1. INSTALL HOLDER BASE
text: VESA holders are usually made of two parts, one is attached to the wall (the base), and the other is attached to the led panel.
Place the led holder base at the middle of the top shelf with one hand, and mark the position of the holes with a pen.

sections.title: 2. DRILL HOLDER BASE HOLES
text: Using the mark done previously, make 2 holes, watch out that the drill is the right size for you screws (ie. the screw should be slightly larger).

sections.title: 3. SCREW LED HOLDER
text: Get help from your buddy to screw the LED holder's base in place.

sections.title: 4. ATTACH TO LED PANEL
text: Now take the other part of the led holder, the one that goes on the led panel.
You can use zip ties or screws to attach the led holder to the led panel.

sections.title: 5. Attach both parts together
text: Attach both parts of the led holder together, and add the tightening screw.

sections.title: 6. Plug the led panel to your controller
text: And you're halfway good to grow.

sections.title: INSTALL THE APP
text: The control app is available on (nearly) all platforms.
android/iOS and Windows/Mac/Linux
First step is to download our app on your appstore (close beta).
Then follow the instructions on screen. First step is turning the controller ON
You don't need to have the LEDs or motors plugged in at that point.

sections.title: CONNECT TO THE CONTROLLER'S WIFI
text: The initial setup process is done by directly connecting to the controller's wifi network.
Go to your phone's settings, and connect to the following wifi:
SSID:
Password: multipass

sections.title: CONNECT TO THE CONTROLLER'S WIFI
text: This is when you can plug your lights for a little test.
Once all lights are plugged in, press the Test LEDs button.
All LEDs should go ON and then OFF one by one.

sections.title: BOX CONFIGURATION
text: Under the LED testing section, you'll find different presets for the most common configurations.
As of now, the 2 presets are either one box, or two boxes.
One box mode
When selecting one box, all LEDs are in the box #1 and timer is preset to vegging times (18h ON and 6h OFF).
Two boxes mode

When two boxes is selected, you'll have the first 4 lights in the box #1 with its timer preset to bloom schedules (12h ON and 12h OFF. And all the remaining LEDs in the box #2 with its timer set to vegging schedules (18h ON and 6h OFF).

sections.title: CONNECT TO YOUR HOME WIFI
text: This step is Optional
Once all is setup, you can connect the controller to the internet.
This will allow it to do alert notifications when things go wrong, give you remote monitoring, and automatic firmware upgrades to access latest features as they come.

sections.title: INTRODUCTION
text: Welcome to the SGL grow diaries/assistant app :)
Follow along this guide to get started with the SGL app and initial set up.
Because we are working on creating the ultimate app for growers we need your help to understand how the app is used; thank you for sharing your experience with us.
Your data will not be shared with any 3rd parties.

sections.title: MEET TOWELIE
text: Towelie is your personal grow assistant.
Teaching you how to grow and helping you with reminders, tips&tricks, etc.
Here he offers the SGL growing checklist - recommended products for succesful growing.

sections.title: ADD YOUR FIRST PLANT
text: Let Towelie guide you to adding your first plant.
What strain are you going to grow?
Type in the name of your plant and press 'create plant'.
Planning on growing more than 1 plant of the same strain in the same box? Uncheck 'Single plant grow diary'.

sections.title: CREATE YOUR LAB
text: The Lab is the place your plant(s) will grow in; give it a inspiring name and press next :)

sections.title: SET UP YOUR CONTROLLER
text: recommended for Android - optional for iOS.
Switch off mobile data. Because the controller isn't connected to the Internet yet some Android phones try to bypass via mobile data.

sections.title: CONNECT YOUR CONTROLLER
text: Press 'Connect Controller' and let the app look for and connect to the controller automatically :)

sections.title: NAME YOUR CONTROLLER
text: Name your controller; easily know which controller manages which lab and also allows you to directly connect to it if you were to reinstall the app.

sections.title: TEST LEDS
text: Test and identify which LED is connected to which channel.

sections.title: CONNECT TO YOUR HOME WIFI
text: Type in your SSID (WIFI name), password, and press 'Next'.
The controller only connects to 2.4GHz wifi - not 5GHz

sections.title: SELECT LEDS
text: Select which LED channels are in your lab.
Unasigned LED channels can be assigned later to another lab.

sections.title: SET UP COMPLETE!
text: Good job! You're all set up and ready to start growing :)
Towelie will assist you moving forward.
Need extra help setting everything up? Hit us up on Discord

sections.title: INTRODUCTION
text: Germination is the first step when starting from seed :)
This guide will teach you how to successfuly germinate your seeds with a battle tested method; the shot glass.
Seeds are made to survive through winter and sprout when 3 conditions are met:
Water: activates the seed’s growth hormones while making the shell easier to break through.
Temperature: signals the plant it is safe to sprout, winter is over
Oxygen: determines how deep the seed is, low oxygen would mean it’s too deep and won’t be able to reach the surface in time.

sections.title: STEP 1
text: Fill a small glass with luke warm bwater (75-80°F / 23-27°C). Tap water is fine, as long as the pH is not too high (7.3 pH is good).

sections.title: STEP 2
text: Place your seed(s) on the surface, they should float.
Leave nature do it's thing, avoid touching them ;)

sections.title: STEP 3
text: Place the glass in a completely dark place, a cupboard works well.
The process usually takes between 24-72hours.
Don't forget to label your glass if you are germinating different strains at the same time.

sections.title: STEP 4
text: The taproot is the main root that will sprout from the seed, once it reaches 1-2cm (1/2 in) it's ready to be sown!
